review: I like the product, its an improvement of my prior Apple TV unit which had worn down with age apparently.However the issue is that this unit, which purported to be new, is not new.  It is previously owned and arrived fully loaded with the prior owners configuration including Apple ID, home sharing, Netflix account, language, region, and time zone.  Therefore, it creates a question as to the source- if one wishes to obtain a new and authentic Apple product perhaps one must buy it directly from the Apple store.  This is evidently a reconditioned unit from Gazelle or some such place, and the reconditioning did not even involve resetting the device.

review: The Apple TV is pretty sweet.It comes preloaded with 20-30 video apps like a Roku does (including Netflix and Crackle, but sadly not Amazon Prime).  Most of the apps require a subscription, but at least they all have a trial period of some length, which vary from a handful of shows to 2 weeks or so.You can mirror your iOS device or MacBook (2011 or newer) to the Apple TV wirelessly.  Mirroring is great because you can stream videos and music in HD, (including the Amazon Prime that isn't included as an app).The wireless tech this uses is clever and works great. Instead of using Bluetooth, the Apple TV and device connect to the same wireless network.You can also play music, movies, and videos that you have purchased with your Apple ID.  The Apple ID integration across all Apple devices at allows you to stream all purchased content over the cloud is quite impressive.As an added bonus Apple just lowered the price from $99 to $69.Overall I am impressed by the Apple TV and I will keep it in mind for gifts for family and friends.
author: A. Fujikawa
